configparam.description:
Specifies the details of database tables and any special columns they might have.
Column Description: table Table Name. Key column of .db.tbls specifies the name of table. cat Table category. Assigns a broad categorization to the table, determining a number of physical storage and data handling attributes. partCol Partition column. Name of column used for partitioning. If unset for partitioned tables, will default to first timestamp column. updTsCol Update Timestamp Column. Name of column used by DBW to determine the age of any given record. If unset will look for updateTS, histUpdateTS, ees_update_time in table schema. rdbAttrs RDB attributes. Column-level kdb+ attributes applied to RDB and other in-memory versions of the table. Specified as a comma-separated list of colon-separated column/attribute pairs. To remove an attribute from a column place nothing after the column (i.e. “colName:”). To remove all attributes from the columns place a single colon in the cell. hdbAttrs HDB attributes. Column-level kdb+ attributes applied to on-disk version of the table. Specified as a comma-separated list of colon-separated column/attribute pairs. To remove an attribute from a column place nothing after the column (i.e. “colName:”). To remove all attributes from the columns place a single colon in the cell idbAttrs IDB attributes. Column-level kdb+ attributes applied to on-disk, intraday versions of the table. Specified as a comma-separated list of colon-separated column/attribute pairs. To remove an attribute from a column place nothing after the column (i.e. “colName:”). To remove all attributes from the columns place a single colon in the cell rdbSortCols RDB sort columns. Ordered, comma-separated list of column names specifying sort order applied to RDB in-memory versions of the table. hdbSortCols HDB sort columns. Ordered, comma-separated list of column names specifying sort order applied to on-disk versions of the table. idbSortCols IDB sort columns. Ordered, comma-separated list of column names specifying sort order applied to on-disk, intraday versions of the table. hdbRetPrtns HDB retention partitions. Table-specific override of global parameter. fks Foreign keys. Columns that reference primary keys of other KxS tables. Specified as comma-separated list of colon-separated column/table pairs. In cases where the column name matches the primary key of exactly one other table in the system, the table can be omitted. exclDeps Exclude Dependencies: The list is used to exclude any intentional circular foreign-key dependencies when computing the correct table order for ingestion. extKeys External keys. Comma-separated list of colon-separated lists of column names forming alternate keys. ncCols No-case columns. Comma-separated list of columns for which case-insensitive search is supported by master data query framework. dictCols Dictionary columns. Comma-separated list of columns containing dictionaries (used by master data query framework). serCols Serialization columns. Columns which are serialized before writedown. miscCols Miscellaneous columns: Additional category-dependent columns. dbwMaxRows DBW maximum rows: Maximum rows cached in DBW. isRel Relationship: Indicates if table defines a time-dated master data relationship. hasSentinel Sentinel: Indicates if table has leading sentinel row (to prevent coercion of column type). pseudos Pseudo-columns: Synthetic columns that are treated by APIs as actual columns. valFn Validation function: Database table validation routine (expected to be in <.val> namespace). comment Descriptive comment.
